intro: Scabiosa laxiflora, commonly known as the looseflower scabious, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of small, pink or white flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the stems are often hairy and branched. Scabiosa laxiflora is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
